Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name with traffic where binary.tags = "Threat level:high" AND source.platform = windows last 30m

Investigation.Label: Devices running high-threat binaries with suspicious traffic

Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Devices running high-threat binaries with suspicious traffic</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>model</string> <string>os_name</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList> <string>traffic</string> </AggregateList> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>binary</Object> <Field>tags</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>"Threat level:high"</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> <LastMinutes>30</LastMinutes> </Investigation>

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (user.euf_d884f40724cd4d91b2caa871aa297970_status = declined OR user.euf_d884f40724cd4d91b2caa871aa297970_status != declined) AND source.platform = windows last 30m
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Devices notified of isolation</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>model</string> <string>os_name</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>user</Object> <Field>euf_d884f40724cd4d91b2caa871aa297970_status</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>declined</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>user</Object> <Field>euf_d884f40724cd4d91b2caa871aa297970_status</Field> <Comparer>!=</Comparer> <Value>declined</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> <LastMinutes>30</LastMinutes> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Cleanup disk
Action.Description: Proposes to the user to cleanup the disk. Two cleanup options (light or deep) are proposed. If the user declines or postpones the campaign, then we ask again after 24 hours. If the user shows the campaign but declines the help, then we never ask again.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.system_drive_free <= 15.68GB AND source.platform = windows last 1h
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Cleanup disk target devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>id</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>system_drive_free</Field> <Comparer><=</Comparer> <Value>15.68GB</Value> <Operand>volume</Operand> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> <LastHours>1</LastHours> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Disk Cleanup
Action.Description: An assisted-help campaign is triggered to perform a light (recycle bin) or a deep (recycle bin and user temporary folder) clean. In order to run a silent execution, campaign can be skipped by providing an empty GUID as input DiskCleanupCampaignId. In such case, CleanupLevel determines how cleanup will be processed.

Output.Name: CleanupSpace
Output.Label: Cleanup Space
Output.Description: Space freed

Action.Name: Clear cookies and temp files of IE

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (event.status = crash AND (event.kind = perf and (event.status=freeze or event.status=crash))) AND source.platform = windows last 10m
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Devices with Outlook crash</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>entity</string> <string>action_200f647eaf11e5396fbb92385886ce33</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>execution_error</Object> <Field>status</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>crash</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> <LastMinutes>10</LastMinutes> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Copy Windows Small Memory Dump Files
Action.Description: During execution, script copies collected Windows small memory dump files to the network shared folder provided as an input parameter.

Output.Name: NumberOfSmallDumps
Output.Label: Number Of Small Dumps
Output.Description: Number of copied Windows small memory dump files

Output.Name: OutputNetworkPath
Output.Label: Output Network Path
Output.Description: Output folder created in network shared folder provided as an input parameter

Action.Name: Get Application Crash Details
Action.Description: Provides the error information obtained from Get-WinEvent for the application name provided via parameter.

Output.Name: AppName
Output.Label: App Name
Output.Description: Name of the application with its version

Output.Name: ErrorDate
Output.Label: Error Date
Output.Description: Date when the error was recorded

Output.Name: Exception
Output.Label: Exception
Output.Description: The exception code obtained

Output.Name: FaultAppPath
Output.Label: Fault App Path
Output.Description: Path to the fault app

Output.Name: FaultModulePath
Output.Label: Fault Module Path
Output.Description: Path to the fault module

Output.Name: ModuleName
Output.Label: Module Name
Output.Description: Name of the module that was also affected

Action.Name: Get battery status
Action.Description: The script returns the health status of the battery installed on the laptop, in terms of capacity that it can still hold. Useful for identifying the batteries to be replaced and optimizing the power settings of the devices.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.upgrade_group = wave1 AND source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Pilot Devices (laptops)</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>upgrade_group</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>last_time_on_tcp</string> <string>last_known_connection_status</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>upgrade_group</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>wave1</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 AND 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: ActualCapacity
Output.Label: Actual Capacity
Output.Description: Actual current capacity of the battery, in milliamp hour (mAh)

Output.Name: BatteryHealth
Output.Label: Battery Health
Output.Description: Ratio between actual capacity and designed capacity, expressed as a percentage

Output.Name: DesignedCapacity
Output.Label: Designed Capacity
Output.Description: Initial capacity of the battery, in milliamp hour (mAh)

Action.Name: Get Battery Status
Action.Description: Returns the health status of at most 2 batteries installed on the laptop, in terms of capacity that it can still hold. Useful for identifying the batteries to be replaced and optimize the power settings of the devices.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: Battery1DesignedCapacity
Output.Label: Battery1 Designed Capacity
Output.Description: Initial capacity of battery 1, in milliamp hour (mAh)

Output.Name: Battery1Health
Output.Label: Battery1 Health
Output.Description: Health ratio for battery 1, expressed as a percentage

Output.Name: Battery2DesignedCapacity
Output.Label: Battery2 Designed Capacity
Output.Description: Initial capacity of battery 2, in milliamp hour (mAh)

Output.Name: Battery2Health
Output.Label: Battery2 Health
Output.Description: Health ratio for battery 2, expressed as a percentage

Action.Name: Get BitLocker Information
Action.Description: Returns basic information of BitLocker protection status, including whether volume and key are secured, encryption percentage level, used encryption algorithm, and the protectors used to secure the key.

Output.Name: ADGPOEnabled
Output.Label: AD GPO Enabled
Output.Description: If the device has the GPO for AD backup enabled

Output.Name: ConversionStatus
Output.Label: Conversion Status
Output.Description: The status of the encryption or decryption on the volume

Output.Name: EncryptionMethod
Output.Label: Encryption Method
Output.Description: The encryption algorithm and key size used on the volume

Output.Name: KeyProtectors
Output.Label: Key Protectors
Output.Description: Lists of protectors used to secure the volume's encryption key

Output.Name: ProtectionStatus
Output.Label: Protection Status
Output.Description: Indicates whether the volume and its encryption key (if any) are secured

Output.Name: SystemDriveReady
Output.Label: System Drive Ready
Output.Description: If the device has the system drive on a NTFS file system

Output.Name: TPMIsActive
Output.Label: TPM Is Active
Output.Description: If the device has a Trusted Platform Module activated

Output.Name: TPMIsEnabled
Output.Label: TPM Is Enabled
Output.Description: If the device has a Trusted Platform Module enabled

Output.Name: TPMIsOwned
Output.Label: TPM Is Owned
Output.Description: If the device has a Trusted Platform Module owned

Output.Name: TPMPresent
Output.Label: TPM Present
Output.Description: If the TPM chip is present on the device

Action.Name: Get Device Boot Duration
Action.Description: Collects a wide range of information about device boot - total boot number, average boot time, boot times of various Windows components and most recent boot date.

Output.Name: AverageBootTime
Output.Label: Average Boot Time
Output.Description: Average duration time of all boots

Output.Name: AverageMainPathBootTime
Output.Label: Average Main Path Boot Time
Output.Description: Average time from desktop showing up until system has reached 80% idle during a 10-second idle time

Output.Name: AveragePostBootTime
Output.Label: Average Post Boot Time
Output.Description: Average time from Windows Logo first appearing on screen and until desktop is presented

Output.Name: LastBootDate
Output.Label: Last Boot Date
Output.Description: The most recent boot date

Output.Name: LastBootTime
Output.Label: Last Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time of the most recent boot

Output.Name: LastDeviceInitBootTime
Output.Label: Last Device Init Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time of device hardware initialization. Measured for the most recent boot

Output.Name: LastDriverInitBootTime
Output.Label: Last Driver Init Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time of device drivers load. Measured for the most recent boot

Output.Name: LastKernelInitBootTime
Output.Label: Last Kernel Init Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time of kernel boot. Measured for the most recent boot

Output.Name: LastMainPathBootTime
Output.Label: Last Main Path Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time from Windows Logo first appearing on screen and until desktop is presented. Measured for the most recent boot

Output.Name: LastPostBootTime
Output.Label: Last Post Boot Time
Output.Description: Duration time from desktop showing up until system has reached 80% idle during a 10-second idle time. Measured for the most recent boot

Output.Name: NumberOfBoots
Output.Label: Number Of Boots
Output.Description: Total number of boots

Output.Name: OldestRecordedBoot
Output.Label: Oldest Recorded Boot
Output.Description: The oldest boot date

Action.Name: Get Failed Logins
Action.Description: Obtains information about all failed login attempts. The script can be successfully executed only on devices with 'Audit Logon Events' policy enabled and Windows 10 or Windows 7 installed.

Output.Name: FailedLogins
Output.Label: Failed Logins
Output.Description: Information about failed login attempts (user name, event time, logon failure status code, logon type code)

Output.Name: FailedLoginsCount
Output.Label: Failed Logins Count
Output.Description: Number of failed login attempts. It always shows full number of failed logins even when number of displayed events in 'FailedLogins' output parameter has been truncated due to limited output capacity

Action.Name: Get File Extension Total Size
Action.Description: Obtains a list of files and calculates the total size occupied on the system disk, with regards to the files having the specified extensions.

Output.Name: FileList
Output.Label: File List
Output.Description: The list of files matching the given extensions. In the case the list reaches 1024 characters, the output will be truncated

Output.Name: TotalSize
Output.Label: Total Size
Output.Description: The sum of all the file sizes matching the given file extensions

Action.Name: Get Folder Size
Action.Description: Script provides total size, total number of detected subdirectories and files in provided path.

Output.Name: TotalDirectories
Output.Label: Total Directories
Output.Description: Total number of directories and subdirectories in provided path

Output.Name: TotalFiles
Output.Label: Total Files
Output.Description: Total number of files in provided path

Output.Name: TotalSize
Output.Label: Total Size
Output.Description: Total size of objects in provided path

Action.Name: Get Gpo Startup Impact
Action.Description: Obtains from Windows Event Log a wide range of information about user/machine GPOs applied during user logon/device startup. The script is designed for Windows 7 and 10.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: ComputerGpoCategories
Output.Label: Computer Gpo Categories
Output.Description: List of all device GPOs categories applied on the device

Output.Name: ComputerGpoSuccessfullyApplied
Output.Label: Computer Gpo Successfully Applied
Output.Description: Status of last computer GPOs applied during device startup

Output.Name: ComputerTotalGpoProcessingTime
Output.Label: Computer Total Gpo Processing Time
Output.Description: Duration time device needed to connect to the domain controller, download computer policies, apply them and run startup scripts

Output.Name: DcConnectionTime
Output.Label: Dc Connection Time
Output.Description: Duration time necessary for the device to connect to Domain Controller during user logon

Output.Name: DcInformation
Output.Label: Dc Information
Output.Description: Domain Controller DNS name and IP used during user logon

Output.Name: TotalComputerGpoAppliedTime
Output.Label: Total Computer Gpo Applied Time
Output.Description: Duration time necessary for device to apply all computer policies

Output.Name: TotalUserGpoAppliedTime
Output.Label: Total User Gpo Applied Time
Output.Description: Duration time necessary for the device to apply all user policies

Output.Name: UserGpoCategories
Output.Label: User Gpo Categories
Output.Description: List of all user GPOs categories applied on the device

Output.Name: UserGpoSuccessfullyApplied
Output.Label: User Gpo Successfully Applied
Output.Description: Status of last user GPOs applied during user logon

Output.Name: UserTotalGpoProcessingTime
Output.Label: User Total Gpo Processing Time
Output.Description: Duration time necessary for the device to connect to the domain controller, download user policies and apply them

Action.Name: Get Hardware And BIOS Information
Action.Description: Returns detailed information concerning the Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) and RAM installed on the device. Additionally, the script obtains the serial numbers and types of the installed disks, as well as the BIOS version and release date.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: BIOSDate
Output.Label: BIOS Date
Output.Description: BIOS release date installed on the device

Output.Name: DiskSerialNumberAndType
Output.Label: Disk Serial Number and Type
Output.Description: For each installed disk drive, the number allocated by the manufacturer to identify the physical media and its type (HDD/SDD)

Output.Name: GPUDriverVendor
Output.Label: GPU Driver Vendor
Output.Description: Provider of the graphics card driver

Output.Name: GPUDriverVersion
Output.Label: GPU Driver Version
Output.Description: Version of the graphics card driver

Output.Name: GPUName
Output.Label: GPU Name
Output.Description: Name of the graphics card installed on the device

Output.Name: InstalledRAM
Output.Label: Installed RAM
Output.Description: Amount of RAM currently installed

Output.Name: MaximumRAM
Output.Label: Maximum RAM
Output.Description: Maximum total amount of RAM that can be installed on the device

Output.Name: RAMBankCapacity
Output.Label: RAM Bank Capacity
Output.Description: Capacity of each installed memory bank

Output.Name: RAMBankDeviceLocator
Output.Label: RAM Bank Device Locator
Output.Description: For each installed memory bank, label of the socket or circuit board that holds the memory

Output.Name: RAMBankFormFactor
Output.Label: RAM Bank Form Factor
Output.Description: For each installed memory bank, implementation form factor for the chip

Output.Name: RAMBankManufacturer
Output.Label: RAM Bank Manufacturer
Output.Description: For each installed bank, name of the organization responsible for producing the physical element

Output.Name: RAMBankPartNumber
Output.Label: RAM Bank Part Number
Output.Description: For each installed bank, part number assigned by the organization responsible for producing or manufacturing the physical element

Output.Name: RAMBankSerialNumber
Output.Label: RAM bank serial number
Output.Description: For each installed bank, manufacturer-allocated number to identify the physical element

Output.Name: RAMBankSpeed
Output.Label: RAM Bank Speed
Output.Description: For each installed memory bank, speed of the physical memory, in nanoseconds

Output.Name: RAMBankTotalWidth
Output.Label: RAM Bank Total Width
Output.Description: For each installed memory bank, total width, in bits, of the physical memory, including check or error correction bits

Output.Name: RAMBankVoltage
Output.Label: RAM Bank Voltage
Output.Description: For each installed memory bank, configured voltage for this device, in millivolts

Output.Name: RegistryBIOSVersion
Output.Label: Registry BIOS Version
Output.Description: BIOS version installed on the device obtained from the registry

Output.Name: TotalRAMSlots
Output.Label: Total RAM Slots
Output.Description: Total number of memory slots available on the device

Output.Name: UsedRAMSlots
Output.Label: Used RAM Slots
Output.Description: Number of memory slots currently used

Output.Name: WmiBIOSVersion
Output.Label: WMI BIOS Version
Output.Description: BIOS version installed on the device obtained from the WMI Object 'Win32_BIOS'

Action.Name: Get Last Feature Update Status
Action.Description: Retrieves the local date, the installation status and the name of the Windows Feature Update that was most recently processed on the device.

Output.Name: FeatureName
Output.Label: Feature Name
Output.Description: Full name of the last Windows Feature Update processed on the device

Output.Name: InstallationDate
Output.Label: Installation Date
Output.Description: Local device time of the last Windows Feature Update installation attempt

Output.Name: InstallationStatus
Output.Label: Installation Status
Output.Description: Result status of the last Windows Feature Update installation attempt. Possible values are: 'Unknown', 'InProgress', 'Succeeded', 'SucceededWithErrors', 'Failed', 'Aborted'

Action.Name: Get MS Office info
Action.Description: The script returns several MS Office-related pieces of information, such as the version of the suite, the applications installed, the language preferences, the size of the users Outlook Data Files, and the used space in the OneDrive business account folder. Useful for troubleshooting both Office-related and disk space issues and for managing the Outlook migration to the cloud.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.upgrade_group = wave1 AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Pilot Devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>upgrade_group</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>last_time_on_tcp</string> <string>last_known_connection_status</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>upgrade_group</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>wave1</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: ActiveDisplayLanguage
Output.Label: Active Display Language
Output.Description: Display language currently in use

Output.Name: InstalledApplications
Output.Label: Installed Applications
Output.Description: List of installed Office applications

Output.Name: InstalledDisplayLanguages
Output.Label: Installed Display Languages
Output.Description: List of display languages installed on the device

Output.Name: InstalledEditingLanguages
Output.Label: Installed Editing Languages
Output.Description: List of editing languages installed on the device

Output.Name: MSOfficeVersion
Output.Label: MS Office Version
Output.Description: Version of the Microsoft Office suite installed on the device

Output.Name: NumberOfOSTfiles
Output.Label: Number Of OST files
Output.Description: Number of .OST files stored on the device for the current logged in user

Output.Name: NumberOfPSTfiles
Output.Label: Number Of PST files
Output.Description: Number of .PST files stored on the device for the current logged in user

Output.Name: OneDriveSyncFilesSize
Output.Label: One Drive Sync Files Size
Output.Description: Size on disk of the locally synched OneDrive business account folder for the current logged in user

Output.Name: OSTOverallSize
Output.Label: OST Overall Size
Output.Description: Size of the .OST file, or sum of all .OST files sizes for the current logged in user

Output.Name: PSTOverallSize
Output.Label: PST Overall Size
Output.Description: Size of the .PST file, or sum of all .PST files sizes for the current logged in user

Output.Name: SharepointSyncFilesSize
Output.Label: Sharepoint Sync Files Size
Output.Description: Size on disk of the SharePoint folder(s) locally synched via the OneDrive client for the current logged in user

Action.Name: Get MS Office information
Action.Description: Returns several Microsoft Office-related information, such as the version of the suite, the applications installed, the language preferences, the size of the user's Outlook Data Files and the used space in the OneDrive business account folder. Useful for troubleshooting both Office-related and disk space issues and for managing the Office migration to the cloud. The script is developed for Windows 10 and 7 and Microsoft Office 2010 onwards.

Output.Name: ActiveDisplayLanguage
Output.Label: Active Display Language
Output.Description: Display language currently in use

Output.Name: InstalledApplications
Output.Label: Installed Applications
Output.Description: List of installed Office applications

Output.Name: InstalledDisplayLanguages
Output.Label: Installed Display Languages
Output.Description: List of display languages installed on the device

Output.Name: InstalledEditingLanguages
Output.Label: Installed Editing Languages
Output.Description: List of editing languages installed on the device

Output.Name: MSOfficeVersion
Output.Label: MS Office Version
Output.Description: Version of the Microsoft Office suite installed on the device

Output.Name: NumberOfOSTfiles
Output.Label: Number Of OST Files
Output.Description: Number of .OST files stored on the device

Output.Name: NumberOfPSTfiles
Output.Label: Number Of PST Files
Output.Description: Number of .PST files stored on the device

Output.Name: OneDriveSyncFilesSize
Output.Label: One Drive Sync Files Size
Output.Description: Size on the disk of the OneDrive folder

Output.Name: OSTOverallSize
Output.Label: OST Overall size
Output.Description: Size of the .OST file, or sum of all .OST files' sizes

Output.Name: OtherOneDriveSyncFilesSize
Output.Label: Other One Drive Sync Files Size
Output.Description: Size on the disk of all other data locally synchronized through OneDrive agent

Output.Name: PSTOverallSize
Output.Label: PST Overall size
Output.Description: Size of the .PST file, or sum of all .PST files' sizes

Action.Name: Get number of events in Event Log
Action.Description: The script returns the number of events occurred in the last "n" minutes, categorized by severity level (Critical, Error, Warning and Information). Useful for having an overview on the presence of meaningful events in a given timeframe.

Output.Name: NumberOfCritical
Output.Label: Number Of Critical
Output.Description: Number of events with severity "Critical" occurred in the specified timeframe

Output.Name: NumberOfError
Output.Label: Number Of Error
Output.Description: Number of events with severity "Error" occurred in the specified timeframe

Output.Name: NumberOfInformation
Output.Label: Number Of Information
Output.Description: Number of events with severity "Information" occurred in the specified timeframe

Output.Name: NumberOfWarning
Output.Label: Number Of Warning
Output.Description: Number of events with severity "Warning" occurred in the specified timeframe

Action.Name: Get Old Files Size
Action.Description: Provides total size of files older and newer than the number of days passed since Remote Action execution date.

Output.Name: OldFilesSize
Output.Label: Old Files Size
Output.Description: Total size of files in the given path, older than the Remote Action execution date minus the number of days provided as threshold

Output.Name: RecentlyModifiedFilesSize
Output.Label: Recently Modified Files Size
Output.Description: Total size of files in the given path, newer than the Remote Action execution date minus the number of days provided as threshold

Action.Name: Get OneDrive Status
Action.Description: Checks if the OneDrive application is working properly by reviewing some processes status, registry keys and environment variables.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows

Action.Name: Get Outlook Online
Action.Description: Checks if Outlook, part of Microsoft Office product, is working online.

Output.Name: IsOnline
Output.Label: Is Online

Action.Name: Get Outlook Plugin Crash Details
Action.Description: Retrieves details of Microsoft Outlook plugin crashes, with the focus on the most recent. Scope is limited by the company policy to control Event Log, which serves as a source of information.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: CrashedPluginList

Output.Name: LastCrashedPluginDate

Output.Name: LastCrashedPluginName

Output.Name: MaximumCrashCountPluginName

Action.Name: Get Service Information
Action.Description: The script returns the current status and startup type of each service specified in the parameters. Useful for verifying that the status of critical services (e.g. Antivirus, SCCM agent, core business applications, etc.) is in accordance with corporate policies.

Output.Name: ServiceInformation
Output.Label: Service Information
Output.Description: Name, current status, and startup type of the requested service(s)

Action.Name: Get Startup Impact
Action.Description: Retrieves information of application impact on login process of last logged in user. Result data is similar to the information in the Startup tab in Windows Task Manager, enhanced by detailed impact of each application.

Output.Name: HighImpactActionableApplications
Output.Label: High Impact Actionable Applications
Output.Description: Actionable names of programs with a high startup impact

Output.Name: HighImpactApplications
Output.Label: High Impact Applications
Output.Description: Details (CPU time in ms, Disk I/O in MB) of programs with a high startup impact

Output.Name: HighImpactCount
Output.Label: High Impact Count
Output.Description: Number of applications with a high startup impact

Output.Name: LastStartUpAnalysisDate
Output.Label: Last Start Up Analysis Date

Output.Name: LowImpactActionableApplications
Output.Label: Low Impact Actionable Applications
Output.Description: Actionable names of programs with a low startup impact

Output.Name: LowImpactApplications
Output.Label: Low Impact Applications
Output.Description: Details (CPU time in ms, Disk I/O in MB) of programs with a low startup impact

Output.Name: LowImpactCount
Output.Label: Low Impact Count
Output.Description: Number of applications with a low startup impact

Output.Name: MediumImpactActionableApplications
Output.Label: Medium Impact Actionable Applications
Output.Description: Actionable names of programs with a medium startup impact

Output.Name: MediumImpactApplications
Output.Label: Medium Impact Applications
Output.Description: Details (CPU time in ms, Disk I/O in MB) of programs with a medium startup impact

Output.Name: MediumImpactCount
Output.Label: Medium Impact Count
Output.Description: Number of applications with a medium startup impact

Output.Name: NotMeasuredImpactActionableApplications
Output.Label: Not Measured Impact Actionable Applications
Output.Description: Actionable names of programs not measured by Microsoft Windows

Output.Name: NotMeasuredImpactApplications
Output.Label: Not Measured Impact Applications
Output.Description: Applications that were started but whose startup impacts were not measured by Microsoft Windows

Output.Name: UserSID
Output.Label: User SID
Output.Description: User SID (Security Identifier) to whom the XML file containing the stats belongs

Action.Name: Get Teams Info
Action.Description: Shows the login errors of the last 24h, the deployment ring, network errors and calls made using Teams.

Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows devices with Teams</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>os_name</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>model</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>product</Object> <Field>name</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>"Microsoft Teams"</Value> <Operand>string</Operand> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: AuthenticationErrors

Output.Name: Calls

Output.Name: DeploymentRing

Output.Name: NetworkAccessDenied

Action.Name: Get User Folder Size
Action.Description: Script provides total size, total number of detected subdirectories and files in provided path relative to current user folder.

Output.Name: TotalDirectories
Output.Label: Total Directories
Output.Description: Total number of directories and subdirectories in provided path

Output.Name: TotalFiles
Output.Label: Total Files
Output.Description: Total number of files in provided path

Output.Name: TotalSize
Output.Label: Total Size
Output.Description: Total size of objects in provided path

Action.Name: Get Wi-Fi Signal Strength
Action.Description: Informs users who are not connected to a corporate network and have a connection strength lower than the threshold specified that their connection is not good for optimal work. In addition gets feedback on the usefulness of the campaign.

Output.Name: AdjacentChannelsCongestion
Output.Label: Adjacent Channels Congestion
Output.Description: If there is noise caused by competing networks using adjacent channels with respect to the active wireless network

Output.Name: AdjacentChannelsList
Output.Label: Adjacent Channels List
Output.Description: Details of the adjacent competing networks if there are any. The list is in CSV format

Output.Name: BadSignalCount
Output.Label: Bad Signal Count
Output.Description: Number of times the Wi-Fi signal quality was below the acceptable signal threshold during the current day

Output.Name: BadSignalPercentage
Output.Label: Bad Signal Percentage
Output.Description: Percentage of time the Wi-Fi signal quality was below the acceptable signal threshold during the current day

Output.Name: CoChannelCongestion
Output.Label: Co Channel Congestion
Output.Description: If there is noise caused by competing networks using the same channel as the active wireless network

Output.Name: CoChannelsList
Output.Label: Co Channels List
Output.Description: Details of the co-channel competing networks if there are any. The list is in CSV format

Output.Name: ConnectedToCorporateWiFi
Output.Label: Connected To Corporate Wi Fi
Output.Description: If the device is connected to a wireless network categorized as corporate

Output.Name: UserConsideredTipAsUseful
Output.Label: User Considered Tip As Useful
Output.Description: If the user answered to the campaign affirmatively

Output.Name: WiFiChannel
Output.Label: Wi Fi Channel
Output.Description: Channel used by the active wireless network

Output.Name: WiFiRadioType
Output.Label: Wi Fi Radio Type
Output.Description: Radio type used by the device's adapter connected to the active wireless network

Output.Name: WiFiSignalQuality
Output.Label: Wi Fi Signal Quality
Output.Description: Signal quality percentage as presented by Windows

Output.Name: WiFiSignalQualityAverage
Output.Label: Wi Fi Signal Quality Average
Output.Description: Wi-Fi signal quality average during the current day

Output.Name: WiFiSpeed
Output.Label: Wi Fi Speed
Output.Description: Speed of the connected wireless network in Mbps (Megabits per second)

Output.Name: WiFiStrengthInDbm
Output.Label: Wi Fi Strength In Dbm
Output.Description: Signal strength in dBm

Action.Description: Provides a set of fields with information about engine, product version, full and quick scans age, definition files (last update) and status of several components.

Action.Name: Get Windows Information
Action.Description: Returns the following information: * Windows build name. * Date on which Windows has been installed. * Display language currently set in Windows. * List of the user accounts defined on the local computer. * PowerShell, Java, Python and .Net versions. * Execution policies for PowerShell. * Status of the BitLocker Drive Encryption. * Reboot information.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Description: The encryption algorithm and key size used on the volume

Output.Name: BitLockerKeyProtectors
Output.Label: Bit Locker Key Protectors
Output.Description: Lists of protectors used to secure the volume's encryption key

Output.Name: BitLockerPercentageEncrypted
Output.Label: Bit Locker Percentage Encrypted
Output.Description: The percentage of volume that is currently encrypted

Output.Name: BitLockerProtectionStatus
Output.Label: Bit Locker Protection Status
Output.Description: Indicates whether the volume and its encryption key (if any) are secured

Output.Name: DotNetVersion
Output.Label: Dot Net Version
Output.Description: Latest version of .Net

Output.Name: JavaVersion
Output.Label: Java Version
Output.Description: Default version of Java

Output.Name: LastReboot
Output.Label: Last Reboot
Output.Description: Date and time of last reboot. It also considers reboots performed while the device was offline (no connection between the Nexthink Collector and the Engine)

Output.Name: NumberOfDaysSinceLastReboot
Output.Label: Number Of Days Since Last Reboot

Output.Name: PSPolicyProcess

Output.Name: PSUserPolicy

Output.Description: Execution policy set through the user GPO

Output.Name: PSVersion

Output.Name: PythonVersion

Output.Description: Default version of Python

Output.Name: SecureBootEnabled

Output.Name: StartupMode

Output.Description: Name of machine startup mode: 'UEFI' or 'BIOS'

Output.Name: WindowsBuild

Output.Name: WindowsLocalAccounts

Action.Name: Get Windows Registry key values
Action.Description: The script returns the value data of up to five leaf items in the Windows Registry. Useful for gathering information regarding, for example, the device configuration, the installed software, and the physical components. Beware that depending on the location of the data to be retrieved in the Registry, the script has to be executed either in the Local System or Current Interactive User context.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.upgrade_group = wave1 AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Pilot Devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>last_time</string> <string>upgrade_group</string> <string>entity</string> <string>last_ip_address</string> <string>last_time_on_tcp</string> <string>last_known_connection_status</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>upgrade_group</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>wave1</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Get WMI data
Action.Description: The script returns instances of Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) classes. Useful for retrieving miscellaneous pieces of information and for assessing the status of the devices. Beware that depending on the exact WMI query to process, running the script may result on a very resource intensive computation. Double-check that no side effects are noticeable before deploying the remote action at a large scale.

Output.Name: PropertyValues
Output.Label: Startup commands
Output.Description: Commands that run automatically when a user logs onto the computer system

Action.Name: Invoke Network Assessment Tool
Action.Description: Using Microsoft Skype for Business Network Assessment Tool connects to nearby Microsoft node to test voice call quality (round trip time, jitter, packet loss rate, packet reorder ratio). Results are calculated based on 90 percentile of values per metric. Tool is applicable for quality test of Microsoft Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams.

Output.Name: Jitter
Output.Label: Jitter
Output.Description: Average time difference of packet arrival

Output.Name: JitterTestPassed
Output.Label: Jitter Test Passed
Output.Description: Microsoft quality test result of average jitter during test call

Output.Name: PacketLossRate
Output.Label: Packet Loss Rate
Output.Description: Fraction of the total transmitted packets that did not arrive at the receiver

Output.Name: PacketLossRateTestPassed
Output.Label: Packet Loss Rate Test Passed
Output.Description: Microsoft quality test result of packet loss during test call

Output.Name: PacketReorderRatio
Output.Label: Packet Reorder Ratio
Output.Description: Ratio of the total transmitted packets that did not arrive in correct order at the receiver

Output.Name: PacketReorderRatioTestPassed
Output.Label: Packet Reorder Ratio Test Passed
Output.Description: Microsoft quality test result of average jitter during test call

Output.Name: RTTLatency
Output.Label: RTT Latency
Output.Description: Round trip time latency between device and Microsoft server node

Output.Name: RTTLatencyTestPassed
Output.Label: RTT Latency Test
Output.Description: Microsoft quality test result of packet round trip time during test call

Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls due to "NetworkMOSDegradation > 1.0"

Output.Name: PoorVideoPacketLossPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Packet Loss Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls due to "PacketLossRate > 0.1"

Output.Name: PoorVideoPacketLossRatePerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Packet Loss Rate Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls due to "VideoPacketLossRate > 0.1"

Output.Name: PoorVideoPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls

Output.Name: PoorVideoPostFECPLRPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Post FEC PLR Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls due to "VideoPostFECPLR > 0.1"

Output.Name: PoorVideoRoundTripPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Round Trip Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls due to "RoundTripTime > 500 ms"

Output.Name: PoorVideoWifiPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Wifi Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls over Wifi

Output.Name: PoorVideoWiredPerc
Output.Label: Poor Video Wired Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of poor quality video calls over Ethernet

Output.Name: ShortAudioPerc
Output.Label: Short Audio Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of short audio calls

Output.Name: ShortVideoPerc
Output.Label: Short Video Perc
Output.Description: Percentage of short video calls

Output.Name: TotalAudio
Output.Label: Total Audio
Output.Description: Total number of audio calls

Output.Name: TotalCalls
Output.Label: Total Calls
Output.Description: Total number of calls (audio + video + screen sharing)

Output.Name: TotalSharing
Output.Label: Total Sharing
Output.Description: Total number of screen sharing calls

Output.Name: TotalVideo
Output.Label: Total Video
Output.Description: Total number of video calls

Output.Name: VersionAndTracingLevel
Output.Label: Version And Tracing Level
Output.Description: Version and tracing level configured

Action.Name: Test certificate pair is valid
Action.Description: Tests if the certificate pair is present and valid on the device. In addition, provides a warning if the certificate is about to expire in the days specified as an input parameter.

Output.Name: PrivateUserCertificateAboutToExpire
Output.Label: Private User Certificate About To Expire
Output.Description: If private user certificate expiration date is within range parameter "PrivateUserCertificateExpireInLessThanDays" - now

Output.Name: PrivateUserCertificateValid
Output.Label: Private User Certificate Valid
Output.Description: If private user certificate issued using company certificate is present and has not expired

Output.Name: PublicCompanyCertificateValid
Output.Label: Public Company Certificate Valid
Output.Description: If public certificate is present and has not expired

Action.Name: Test Computer Group Policy Applied In Days Range
Action.Description: Compares last time computer group policy was applied on target device against provided time range.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where (source.computer_type = desktop OR source.computer_type = laptop) AND source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="13" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows laptops and desktops</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description /> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>average_login_duration</string> <string>score_43b5ed8474b9604d10667444164cae99</string> <string>entity</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>desktop</Value> </ObjectCondition> <ObjectCondition IsTemplate="false"> <Object>source</Object> <Field>computer_type</Field> <Comparer>=</Comparer> <Value>laptop</Value> </ObjectCondition> </ObjectConditionList> <ObjectsConditionsExpression>1 OR 2</ObjectsConditionsExpression> </Investigation>

Output.Name: ComputerGroupPolicyApplied
Output.Label: Computer Group Policy Applied
Output.Description: Whether or not Computer Group Policy was applied in provided time frame. Expected values are [Yes/No]

Action.Name: Test Office 365 Network Access
Action.Description: Tests TCP connection to Microsoft Office 365 services specified in input parameters. For domain ranges only parent domains are considered, for IP ranges first, last and middle hosts are considered.

Output.Name: DomainFailing
Output.Label: Domain Failing
Output.Description: List of domains reported as failing to connect

Output.Name: IPRangeFailing
Output.Label: IP Range Failing
Output.Description: List of IP addresses or IP ranges reported as failing to connect

Output.Name: RequiredConnectivityAvailable
Output.Label: Required Connectivity Available
Output.Description: Confirmation if network access to all specified Microsoft services is allowed

Output.Name: ServiceNameFailing
Output.Label: Service Name Failing
Output.Description: List of services reported as failing to connect

Action.Name: Test Pending Reboot
Action.Description: Script retrieves information if device is pending reboot and the reason. Possible causes covered are as follow: * Computer renaming. * Domain join. * File rename operations. * SCCM Agent. * Software installation. * Windows update.

Output.Name: PendingReboot
Output.Label: Pending Reboot
Output.Description: Device is reboot-pending (Yes/No)

Output.Name: PendingRebootReason
Output.Label: Pending Reboot Reason
Output.Description: All detected reasons for reboot-pending

Action.Name: Update GPOs
Action.Description: The script refreshes local and Active Directory-based Group Policy settings, including security settings, by executing the gpupdate command both on the Computer and the User scope. Useful for remediating various issues on the endpoints and for ensuring compliance of devices.

Output.Name: ComputerScope
Output.Label: Computer Scope
Output.Description: Outcome of gpupdate executed on the Computer settings

Output.Name: InteractiveUser
Output.Label: Interactive User
Output.Description: The name of the interactive user on the target device

Output.Name: UserScope
Output.Label: User Scope
Output.Description: Outcome of gpupdate executed on the User settings

Action.Name: Clear Chrome settings
Action.Description: Clears Chrome files according to the specified parameters. Useful for troubleshooting several browsing-related issues. The script is developed for Windows 10 and 7 and Chrome 65 onwards.

Output.Name: CleanedSettings
Output.Label: Cleaned Settings
Output.Description: List of cleaned settings

Action.Name: Clear Internet Explorer 11 settings
Action.Description: Clears Internet Explorer files according to the specified parameters. Useful for troubleshooting several browsing-related issues. The script is designed for Windows 10 and 7 and Internet Explorer 11.

Output.Name: CleanedSettings
Output.Label: Cleaned Settings
Output.Description: List of cleaned settings

Action.Name: Clear Outlook AutoComplete Cache
Action.Description: Clears the AutoComplete cache so user can avoid out-of-date suggestions as a result of a migration process or similar. The script is designed for Windows 10 and 7, and Office 2010, 2013, 2016, including ClickToRun.

Action.Name: Clear Recycle Bin
Action.Description: Check the recycle bins from all logical drives and figures out the size of files inside. The user is notified and a cleaning up is offered.

Output.Name: RecycleBinSize
Output.Label: Recycle Bin Size
Output.Description: The size of the user recycle bin

Action.Name: Disable application from StartUp menu
Action.Description: Disables startup of every application from ApplicationsToDisable parameter, excluding all listed in ApplicationsToKeep parameter. If all applications should be disabled except specific ones, use only ApplicationsToKeep as a white-list and leave ApplicationsToDisable empty (''). If only some specific applications should be disabled, use only ApplicationsToDisable and leave ApplicationsToKeep empty (''). If an application is present in both parameters, ApplicationsToKeep takes precedence and the application will not be removed from StartUp.

Action.Name: Enable BitLocker Encryption
Action.Description: Enables BitLocker encryption in the drive where the OS is installed. By using an input parameter, you can choose to encrypt the entire disk or only the used space. Take a look at the [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/information-protection/bitlocker/bitlocker-overview official Microsoft documentation] to get more information about BitLocker capabilities.

Action.Name: Get Outlook Plugins
Action.Description: Retrieves the installed Microsoft Office Outlook COM Add-ins sorted by status and name. The script is designed for Windows 7 and 10.

Action.Name: Install application
Action.Description: ADVANCED SCRIPT Installs applications using either Microsoft Software Installer (MSI) or custom installers. The remote action includes protection layer to provide secure installation method. That includes verification of the binary hash and signature thumbprint comparison.

Action.Name: Invoke Windows Update
Action.Description: ADVANCED SCRIPT Restarts Windows Update service and starts BITS service (if needed). It forces the device to scan for system updates. The script is designed for Windows 10 and 7.

Action.Name: Reinstall Microsoft Teams
Action.Description: Reinstalls Microsoft Teams to avoid version disparity, broken installed versions or simply because you want the new features offered in new versions.

Action.Name: Repair Office 365
Action.Description: Repairs Office 365 by using Office built-in command line tool. The remote action uses a campaign to ask for user permission to perform the repair. User is adviced to save all Office applications work in progress, since they will be closed before performing the repair. Once the repair is completed, a campaign is displayed to notify its finalization to the user.

Action.Name: Repair OneDrive
Action.Description: Re-installs and repairs OneDrive on the device, mitigating possible issues by re-installation.

Action.Name: Repair Outlook OST Problem
Action.Description: Repairs Outlook problems with OST file by deleting it and restarting Outlook. Runs a campaign to close applications blocking OST file (Outlook and Skype). The script is designed for Windows 10 and 7 and Outlook 2010 onwards.

Action.Name: Reset Print Spooler
Action.Description: Clears the print queue of the user by restarting the Spooler service (and dependent services, if any), cleaning the folder '%systemroot%\System32\spool\printers' and cleaning the Win32_PrintJob jobs. Useful for troubleshooting printing-related issues.

Output.Name: JobFiles
Output.Label: Job Files
Output.Description: Names of the job files deleted

Output.Name: PrintJobs
Output.Label: Print Jobs
Output.Description: Description and owner of the Print jobs cleaned

Output.Name: Service
Output.Label: Service
Output.Description: Information about the Print Spooler service

Action.Name: Restart Device
Action.Description: Retrieves information if restart is necessary due to too long device uptime or pending reboot, and based on provided input configures restart of target device. Campaign is displayed to enable user immediate restart, or postpone till next script execution. After restart, previously opened user's applications are restored.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description>Windows devices only</Description> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>model</string> <string>os_name</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList /> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Restore SCCM Client
Action.Description: Restores SCCM-related client services (SMS Agent, BITS, WMI, etc) and retrieves information about SCCM client on devices.

Output.Name: BITSStatus
Output.Label: Background Intelligent Transfer Service Status
Output.Description: Status of the Background Intelligent Transfer Service

Output.Name: ClientInstalled
Output.Label: Client Installed
Output.Description: If SCCM client is installed or is not

Output.Name: LastCommunication
Output.Label: Last Communication
Output.Description: Last communication date with server

Output.Name: LastCumulativeUpdate
Output.Label: Last Cumulative Update
Output.Description: Last cumulative update installed on the device

Output.Name: ManagementSite
Output.Label: Management Site
Output.Description: Site where the device is connecting to

Output.Name: RPCSubsystemStatus
Output.Label: Remote Procedure Call Subsystem Status
Output.Description: Status of the Remote Procedure Call Subsystem Service

Output.Name: SMSAgentStatus
Output.Label: SMS Agent Status
Output.Description: Status of the SMS Agent Service

Output.Name: WindowsTimeServiceStatus
Output.Label: Windows Time Service Status
Output.Description: Status of the Windows Time Service

Output.Name: WMIStatus
Output.Label: Windows Management Instrumentation Status
Output.Description: Status of the Windows Management Instrumentation Service

Action.Name: Set Fast Start Status
Action.Description: Enables or disables the Windows OS Fast Start feature based on the input provided.

Action.Name: Set OneDrive Configuration
Action.Description: Configures Microsoft OneDrive policy settings of SilentAccountConfig to automatically configure user account instead of having to provide credentials manually, and FilesOnDemand to enable online access to files stored with the service.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description>Windows devices only</Description> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>model</string> <string>os_name</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList /> </Investigation>

Action.Name: Set Outlook online
Action.Description: Checks if Outlook is working offline, and sets it to online if it is not already.

Action.Name: Set Outlook Plugins
Action.Description: Enables or disables each Microsoft Office Outlook COM add-in specified in the parameters. The names of the available add-ins can be found by running the 'Get Outlook Plugins' Remote Action. Campaign can be skipped by providing an empty GUID as input CampaignId.

Output.Name: OutlookPluginsConfigured
Output.Label: Outlook Plugins Configured
Output.Description: List status of all Microsoft Outlook add-ins provided in input argument 'PluginName'

Action.Name: Set Service Information
Action.Description: ADVANCED SCRIPT The script enables the modification of the status and startup type of one or multiple services, which are provided as input. Useful for enforcing the expected status of critical services (e.g. Antivirus, SCCM agent, core business applications, etc.) in accordance with corporate policies.

Output.Name: UpdatedServiceStatus
Output.Label: Updated Service Status
Output.Description: Name, status, and startup type of the requested service (or list of services) before and after the change

Action.Name: System Cleanup
Action.Description: Performs WinSxS folder cleanup using DISM Windows tool, deletes SCCM cached files older than provided age in days, removes user profiles and all types of system memory dump files (small, kernel and full) unused for more than provided threshold in days.

Target.Selector: select source.uid, source.name where source.platform = windows
Target.InvestigationRaw: <Investigation xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" DataModelVersion="12" SyntaxVersion="3"> <Label>Windows devices</Label> <Object>source</Object> <Platforms> <Platform>windows</Platform> </Platforms> <Description>Windows devices only</Description> <FieldList> <string>name</string> <string>platform</string> <string>computer_type</string> <string>model</string> <string>os_name</string> </FieldList> <CategoryList /> <AggregateList /> <ObjectConditionList /> </Investigation>

Output.Name: CleanupSpace
Output.Label: Cleanup Space
Output.Description: Space freed

Action.Name: Uninstall application
Action.Description: ADVANCED SCRIPT Uninstalls applications using Microsoft Software Installer or custom uninstaller, depending on the application.

Action.Name: Update Group Policy Settings
Action.Description: ADVANCED SCRIPT Refreshes computer or user Group Policy settings using the 'gpupdate' command. The script is designed for Windows 10 and 7.

Output.Name: LoggedUser
Output.Label: User Name
Output.Description: User who is currently logged in

Action.Name: Update Windows Defender Definition
Action.Description: If the device doesn't have the last version of the Windows Defender malware or spyware definition, it will force an update.

Action.Name: Remove Credentials From Credential Manager
Action.Description: Removes stored user credentials from Windows Credential Manager, to assist with the problem of locking account. After completing action presents internal password reset webpage using default browser. Uses campaign to inform user about the removal, can be configured to skip campaign notification.
